Authors: K. P. Deepna Latha, P. Manimohan
Title:
Five new species of Inocybe (Agaricales) from tropical India
based on morphological and molecular data
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Inocybaceae, phylogeny, systematics,
tropical taxonomy
Abstract:
Five new species of Inocybe, I. iringolkavensis, I.
keralensis, I. kuruvensis, I. muthangensis and I. wayanadensis are
described from Kerala State, India based on morphological and molecular
data. The phylogenetic relationships of these new species within the
genus are inferred from an analysis of ITS and nLSU-rDNA sequences.
Except I. keralensis that belongs to the Pseudosperma clade, all other
species belong to the Inocybe clade. This study forms the second report
of an Inocybe species (I. muthangensis) that combines entirely
violet-colored basidiomata with nodulose basidiospores.
